result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert A. WORDELL was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Remain in sex offender treatment.

Continue treatment for mental health issue.  

Take all medications as prescribed and in prescribed doses.  

Provide DNA sample.

Minutes.

Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.  Defendant waives his statutory time limits within which a preliminary hearing must be held.  Preliminary hearing is set for 07-10-14 at 8:30 a.m.
Bail is set at $1,500.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that he report to the Two Rivers Police Department for fingerprints, photographs and other identifying information within 24 hours and that he have no contact with any persons under the age of 17 except those that reside in his home and are family members.  Bail furnished.

Adam Snavely, through Public Defender.
